title: Asian Insider: Vietnam flexes ‘bamboo diplomacy’ in China | Church conversions trend in Australia
title_page: Asian Insider: Vietnam flexes ‘bamboo diplomacy’ in China | Church conversions trend in Australia | The Straits Times
maintext:
Dear ST reader,
We hope you’ve been keeping well.
Asia’s leaders remained in the limelight this past week, with Thailand appointing its youngest prime minister in the form of 37-year-old Paetongtarn Shinawatra while elder statesmen from Vietnam, Malaysia and Indonesia visited neighbouring countries to strengthen ties.
On his first trip abroad since being elected Vietnam’s president, Mr To Lam made a beeline for Beijing, where he and President Xi Jinping pledged to deepen bilateral relations. Analysts tell our correspondent Lim Min Zhang that Mr Lam is set to continue Vietnam’s “bamboo diplomacy” of being firm but flexible in its dealings with major powers.
Meanwhile,Malaysia and India elevated their ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership, following talks between their respective prime ministers Anwar Ibrahim and Narendra Modi in New Delhi.
Over in Canberra, Australia and Indonesia unveiled a landmark defence pact during the visit of Indonesian Defence Minister and President-elect Prabowo Subianto.
Further afield, all eyes are on the trilateral partnership between the US, Japan and South Korea, not least because both President Joe Biden and Prime Minister Fumio Kishida are set to step down later this year. Still, analysts assure our correspondent Wendy Teo that the alliance will stay intact because the countries share deep interests beyond defence and security.
